cmCourseInfo.description: A balanced presentation of the multifaceted approach to the discipline by treating Jewish religion and thought. The course introduces students not only to a chronological and thematic overview of the subject, but also to different methodological approaches.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Jewish Thought

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Online Synchronous: Lectures will be delivered online, with synchronous live-streamed lectures to enable real-time contact with the professor and classmates. Lectures will also be recorded and available asynchronously which registered students can access on their own time. Students will have the opportunity for weekly online office hours to ask questions and clarifications about course content and assignments. Students need the ability to view PDFs or PowerPoint slides and to access online library resources and Quercus tools, including Bb Collaborate and Microsoft Teams.

cmCourseInfo.description: General introduction to history, literatures and cultures of Jewish people from antiquity to contemporary. A balanced presentation of multi-disciplinary approaches and multi-methodological approaches to Jewish studies, with a special emphasis on Jewish cultural studies and Jewish secularity.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Jewish Culture

Students need the ability to view PDFs or PowerPoint slides and to access online library resources and Quercus tools, including Bb Collaborate and Microsoft Teams.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

This is an online synchronous course. Classes will be delivered online through a streaming platform (e.g. Bb collaborate, Zoom, etc.). Lectures will be live-streamed at a given day and time and students are expected to attend in real-time.

sections.subTitle: Three Answers to the Jewish Question: Liberalism, Communism, Zionism

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Prerequisites: 5.0 FCEs, at least 2.0 of them in Humanities or Social Sciences. Exclusions: SOC387H1-S.

Delivery Instructions

This is an online synchronous course. Classes will be delivered online through a streaming platform (e.g. Bb collaborate, Zoom, etc.). Lectures will be live-streamed as scheduled and students are expected to attend in real-time.

sections.subTitle: Applied Statistics and Data Science in Jewish Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Online Asynchronous - Lectures are recorded remotely and uploaded onto Quercus for students to view online. Students will watch the recording of the lecture on their own time according to the weekly lecture schedule and submit all assignments and assessments online. Students need internet access and the ability to use Quercus.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

This is an online synchronous course. Lectures and class meetings will be livestreamed to enable real-time contact with the professor and classmates. Lectures will also be recorded and available asynchronously which registered students can access on their own time. Students will have the opportunity for weekly online office hours to ask questions and clarifications about course content and assignments. Students need the ability to view PDFs or PowerPoint slides and to access online library resources and Quercus tools, including Bb Collaborate and Microsoft Teams.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Please contact Natasha Richichi-Fried at cjs.events@utoronto.ca or 416-978-1624 to enrol in this course.

Delivery Instructions

Online Asynchronous - This course will be conducted entirely online. The supervisor of the student project and the student will work out a mutually agreed upon format and schedule to complete this independent study.
